value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI

value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. I thought it is good to explain it in a set of videos, the first one here is about what the TreatAs function is and how it can help to build filters and a virtual relationship between two tables. value.title: ConcatenateX in Power BI and DAX   Concatenate Values of a Column
value.excerpt: It happens often in Power BI calculations and reports that you need to concatenate a list of values from a column. You can do this concatenation in Power Query or DAX. value.title: Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI with NOT IN or NOT EQUAL Rule
value.excerpt: Sometimes when you apply the dynamic row-level security, you want to have the criteria as NOT EQUAL and NOT IN. This can be a bit tricky in the dynamic implementation of RLS because the relationship behavior is normally the opposite. In this video, I’ll explain how you can do that. Download the file

value.title: Exception Reporting in Power BI Catch the Error Rows in Power Query
value.excerpt: To build a robust BI system, you need to cater for errors and handle errors carefully. If you build a reporting solution that the refresh of that fails everytime an error occurs, it is not a robust system. Errors can happen by many reasons, In this video, I’ll show you a way to catch potential errors

value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query

value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Left Outer Join   What it is and how to use it in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: Merging two tables is one of the fundamental operations in any BI or database system. value.title: Move Measures to Another Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: The ability to move measures from one table to another table exists in Power BI, However, the process is not familiar for many users.
